meaningMnemonic:
All your dishonest <kanji>element</kanji>s are <kanji>fix</kanji>ed, making you more <vocabulary>honest</vocabulary> than ever.

This is mostly used to describe people as being honest and <vocabulary>upfront</vocabulary> about their thoughts and emotions. While mostly being positive, it can also be used in a slightly negative way to describe people as being <vocabulary>obedient</vocabulary> and compliant, following instructions and rules without resistance.
readingMnemonic:
The reading for this is a bit of a weird one. It uses on'yomi for 素, then it uses the kun'yomi for 直. You know both readings, but it's all a little strange, so here's a mnemonic help you:

To present yourself as an <vocabulary>honest</vocabulary> person, you should hurry up and change into a <reading>su</reading>it <reading>now</reading> (すなお). We all know that people in suits look more honest and upfront, so go get suited up now!
